intro: Beccarinda sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran beccarinda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Beccarinda sumatrana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
